136264.name: Wer kennt Berlin?
136264.description:
"Who knows Berlin - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Berlin.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

136265.description:
Aliens vs. Zombies ("AvZ"), by designer Chris Taylor, is a two-player game about the life and death (mostly death) battle between two natural enemies: Aliens and Zombies. The Aliens attacked the Earth and destroyed 99% of humanity using orbital death rays. However, the weapon interacted strangely with human DNA and caused an unforeseen mutation! Within 24 hours of death, the recently dead arose and slowly shambled aimlessly with purpose in the general direction of the Alien attackers to take their revenge.

Aliens vs. Zombies is a small, low-complexity wargame for beginners, children and light-hearted fans of aliens and/or zombies. The aliens are invading a small town. A side effect of their weapons used to conquer humanity is the reanimation of the newly dead, who are out for revenge!

The alien player has fewer units but has the advantage of superior weaponry and armor. Zombies are plentiful and are divided into different types: rotting, tough and fast. Both sides can move or attack during their turn. Each side has one unique action: aliens can blast away with exploding dice and zombies can chomp their opponents to create new allies.

Each turn a tile is revealed with a number of zombie spawns and special events. After the 8th turn, the zombie dead (those deader than usual) are counted to determine the victor.

Which side will you choose? Choose wisely and conquer, in Aliens vs. Zombies!

Complexity: 2 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 6 on a 9 scale
136265.name: Aliens vs. Zombies

136266.name: Alfabet Spel
136266.description:
The game consists of a board with an empty crossword grid with alternating 2 x 2 grids in white, black and red. Each player receives 48 letters and joker tiles, some of which are black, some red and some white.
Each player now draws 7 of his/her letters into the hand. The first player forms a word on the board, then draws new letters. However, placing a red tile on a red square means the player can draw an extra tile; placing a non-black letter on a black field or a black letter on a non-black field means the player has to drop a letter. Other players follow in turn order, adding letters to the first word crossword-style. The first player to get rid of all of his/her tiles is the winner.

136267.name: Protect or Infect
136267.description:
Protect or Infect is a turn-based strategy board game set in the early stages of a zombie outbreak. This game takes place several weeks into the infection at a point where the zombies seem to have the upper hand; not only in numbers but also in mutated ability. Four humans surviving together have taken refuge in a country side manor. On the run, down to just knives and pistols, and being stalked by countless zombies that are leading a monster directly to them, the survivors hold themselves up and wait for rescue within the halls of the zombie manor.

The game pits a team of 4 survivors against a team of zombies; each team consists of at least 1 player per side with up to 4 players on each team. The game takes place on a grid based board detailing the basement, first floor, 2nd floor, and grounds of an abandoned manor.

The goal of the survivor team is to hold out within the manor grounds for 20 rounds at which point a rescue vehicle spawns. They must then make it to the rescue vehicle with at least 2 survivors making it to safety in order to win. The survivor team can scavenge for items, barricade doors and windows with furniture and wood, and seek out strategic locations within the manor or its grounds to help aid them through the game (60+ weapons, health items, equipment, zombie traps, and weapon upgrades).

Alternatively, the survivor team can kill the zombie team boss character, The Harvester, thereby ending the zombie teams ability to spawn more zombies. Once all zombies are cleared the survivor team wins.

The goal of the zombie team is to kill all of the survivor characters in order to win. The zombie team gains 'spawn points' at the beginning of every round that can be saved up or spent on the 7 different classes of zombies available. Each class costs a varying number of spawn points depending on their stats: movement speed, health, attack dmg, and special ability. The zombie team also controls a zombie boss character, The Harvester. The Harvester is the strongest and most versatile zombie of the game but if it is destroyed the zombie team can no longer spawn zombies.

136268.name: Jackpot Slots
136268.description:
The thrill of the "one-armed bandit" has lured gamblers since the end of the 19th Century. From the original Poker-themed games to "Liberty Bell" - the first true slot machine as we know it today - to the complex electronic games of today, the slots have become the world's most popular casino game. JACKPOT SLOTS brings the excitement of the casino to the board game table.


JACKPOT SLOTS is the umbrella title for two slot-machine themed games:

WINNING LINES is the flagship game. As cards are dealt from a deck of cards bearing slot machine symbols, players seek to claim "winning lines" - combinations of slot machine symbols that pay off - before a lemon card turns up to end the round.

TRIPLE PLAY is a slot machine take on "Memory" in which players seek to uncover "winning lines" while, yet again, avoiding lemon cards.


The allure of the slots is before you! Are you lucky enough to hit the Jackpot?

136269.name: Futebox
136269.description:
Simple rules, great ambiance (soccer), beautiful box: this is Futebox. It is an intuitive game where children learn the rules quickly and can create new rules and possibilities, from the original.
First, each player positions the numbered tokens (1 to 6). In your turn you roll the die; only the token with the same number can be moved. When a token pass the goal line, the player scores.

136270.name: Battle for the Pacific (PS2/Wii)
136270.description:
User Summary

The game features fighting in some of the most historic battles in the Pacific campaign in large, lush environments from the Battle of Corregidor and Guadalcanal to the closing days of Iwo Jima.

In contrast to the Xbox 360, PlayStation 3 and PC version the PlayStation 2 and Wii versions have a lonesome, similar to the early Medal of Honor games, approach and do not support a multiplayer mode.

136271.name: History Channel: Battle for the Pacific
136271.description:
User Summary

The game features fighting in some of the most historic battles in the Pacific campaign, in large, lush environments, from the Battle of Corregidor and Guadalcanal to the closing days of Iwo Jima.

This edition features, in contrast to the PS2/Wii edition, squad-based missions. Two soldiers and an NCO fight by your side while other soldiers help out as well.
One noticeable aspect is that the player cannot wander too far off from the commanding soldier or else the mission will be terminated. This limits free roaming and creates a more linear single player experience.

This edition also includes a multiplayer mode.

136272.name: After the Fall
136272.description:
With civilization decimated, you and your fellow survivors struggle to eke out subsistence and build self-sufficiency before the harsh winter sets in. Can you survive after the fall?

Each player has established an outpost in one of five home bases, from the scrap yard to the mansion. They begin the game with a leader character who has a special ability plus six community members. Each turn the players' improvements produce resources. Then, everyone allocates their people to either scavenge for resources and equipment or build new improvements. Players can also trade to improve the overall community's chance of survival. Finally, resources must be spent to keep the members alive. Over the course of the game, winter sets in. After the fall, the winner is the player whose base is best equipped to survive, and the overall community score determines the fate of the entire human race.

136273.name: Battle Tank: Escape From Giant Robot Island
136273.description:
Battle Tank: Escape from Giant Robot Island is a modular strategy board game for 2-4 players which pits battle tanks against giant robots. The players take on one of four roles, Mad Scientist Dr. Victor von Mechanstein, Sergeant Roger Stammel, OSI Agent Cynthia Collins or henchmech E-Gore Mk.IV.

Gameplay progresses in turns with each player moving their token(s) then resolving attacks before play passes to the next player. Each unit has a set movement rate and attacks are resolved by rolling a six-sided die (D6) and then comparing the number rolled to the range and the target's armor.

Each character has two of its own, often opposing, goals. One goal is active and ends the game on the turn it is achieved, and the other goal is passive and is only checked after 10 turns have been played. Mechanstein wants to prevent his tanks from being taken off the island, Stammel simply wants to escape with his soldiers, Collins wants intelligence on the Mad Scientist's forces and E-gore wants to please its master by recapturing the prisoners.

Each turn the tank players move toward the beach as more and more robots appear to stop them.

The action is modified by two sets of cards: Mad Scientist Events and Tanker Tactics. Events are large scale effects that change the game in some way or affect all the players tics are short and Tactics are minor effects that can give a boost to many actions as well as repair damage, improve speed or even find a new tank if one has been destroyed.

The playing area itself consists of 7 hexagonal tiles with a hex-grid printed on them. One tile is Mechanstein's volcanic lair and the other six are unique combinations of roads, cliffs, forests and open terrain. The non-volcano tiles can be rotated to any orientation and placed into one of several formations and are designed in such a way to always have the roads match up.

136274.name: Sibylla
136274.description:
1180... the King is dead... the Barons seek power, while a powerful enemy observes... Who will take the throne of the Latin Kingdom of Sibylla? Battles, betrayals, conspiracies... Use all the power of his noble family, lead your armies, to become the new King!

Sibylla is a board game for 2-5 players, developed by Julio Trois, where you must seek power in a game whose theme is the Age of the Crusades!

The game has the mechanics, the area control, through 5 dices, search combinations that allow you to insert markers in each area of the game (same system used in the Poker Dice). You can also use action cards that increase the strategic factor, seeking to undermine the moves of opponents and open up new gameplay opportunities.

136277.name: Denarii
136277.description:
The denarius was minted by the Romans and was in use during the time of Christ through the era of the apostles. It was a silver coin, a bit larger than a dime, bearing the image of the reigning emperor and denarii (plural form of denarius) have been found bearing the image of all 12 Roman emperors. While competing in the game, you will be given 12 denarii to help you along.

On your turn you role two custom dice and move your marker farther along the track on the board. Depending on what color you land on you will be asked a different question from the trivia book. Answer correct and you stay where you are, answer incorrectly and you must return to the last denarii space that you passed or pay a denarii from your supply. To land on the last space you must role the exact number of spaces needed to get there or you can move backwards to give yourself more room.

Denarii was created to help individuals, groups and especially families increase their Bible knowledge and have fun together at the same time. Learning is the main purpose, but there is competition, strategy, challenge and lots of excitement, too.
Even if a player does not give all correct answers, he will learn from others and could still be the winner of the game! There is little advantage for the Bible scholar. Everyone who plays will learn and want to play again!

136278.name: Helix: The Card Game
136278.description:
SUMMARY:
When a biological plague infects most of earth, distorting the newly discovered HELIX strand in our DNA, creating immediate mental defects and physical deterioration. The deformities mutate and the "age of zombies" becomes a reality. A desperate call for help from survivors gathered from around the world; through discovery of a secret United Nations project, awaken a reserve of space marines put in cryogenic suspension to return to earth with only one mission... to save the handful of survivors from becoming assimilated into zombies.

GAME-PLAY:
This is a two player game that generally lasts between 15-30 minutes. The box set comes with two 60 card decks; one for the Space Marines and one for the Zombies. The game offers Character Cards, Action Cards, Equipment Cards (for Space Marines Only), and Survivor Cards. Attacks are directly geared towards the characters and Survivors rather than the players. There is a follow-up expansion set ahead that can be a stand-alone or mixed in with this First Edition set.

GOAL:
To goal for the marines is to save 10 Civilians and help them leave earth safely with them whereas the goal of the zombies are simple.... feed. If the zombies "turn" all the civilians into zombies or kill off all the space marines, the zombies win. If the marines extract 10 civilians or kill off all the zombies, they win.

136279.name: Kreuzwort
136279.description: The word game Kreuzwort features four letter dice and one color die. Each roll of the dice will give players access to two letters, and each player chooses one of those letters and adds it to his personal crossword sheet to form rows and columns of words, scoring points based on how well they do.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2013 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2013 Guldbrikken Best Family Game Nominee
2013 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2013 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2013 Spiel des Jahres Game of the Year Recommended
2014 Gioco dell’Anno Nominee
136280.description:
La Boca, the most famous neighborhood in the Argentinian capital of Buenos Aires, was populated by many Italian immigrants when first founded. The area is best known today for its eccentric skyline, with the houses having been built from scrapped fishing boats and the metal being colorfully painted to create a patchwork effect across the neighborhood.

Creating skylines of similar beauty and eccentricity is the goal of the construction teams that play La Boca. In shifting teams of two that sit across from one another, players try to create skylines on challenge cards – but the players can see the completed image only from their point of view, so they must consult with one another constantly to make sure each colored block ends up in the right location while racing against the timer. The faster the players complete their building, the more points they score. Then the next team takes a seat, breaks down the blocks, then begins building anew. Whoever has the most points after a certain number of rounds will stand atop La Boca and glory in the cheers of the Argentinian public!
136280.name: La Boca
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 16 : BGGcon 2015 Recap - Codenames - Favor of the Pharoah - Time Stories
Episode 19: Orleans Review - Boards Alive Interview - Free Games
Episode 55 - Interview with Stonemaier Games Jamey Stegmaier
Garrett's Games 356 - La Boca and Ultimate Werewolf: Inquisition
Garrett's Games 488 - Cornwall and Gipfelstürmer
La Boca (Kosmos): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 185
The Game Pit: Episode 27 - Top Ten from 2013
The Spiel #187 - Read Between The Signs
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 67!!!
[Actus] N°39-A Des fantômes, des versions cartes et dés, des colons et des joyaux
[Reviews] N°46-B De La Boca à Agricola, c’est du tout bon !

136281.name: Rabbids: Das Kartenspiel
136281.description: The gameplay in Rabbids: Das Kartenspiel is as wild as the rabbits themselves look. One by one, cards are revealed from a deck and placed face-up on the table. If a card shows a rabbit, it's left alone – but ideally the players will take a mental picture of it because if a scoring card is revealed, everyone races to grab all the revealed cards that depict the rabbit shown on this scoring card. Grab the most cards, and you win!

136282.description:
Rabbids: Das Familien-Partyspiel is a collection of sixty short games featuring the funny little rabbits from the Rabbids video game. Your aim in all of these games is to achieve whatever goal is set out for you, whether through skill, intellect, speed or just plain luck. In this game, you'll be called on to do everything, and everyone will receive chances to score. Each game lasts no more than two minutes, and the rules are simple enough that players will be able to jump into games quickly.

In the end, whoever wins the most Rabbids mini-games wins the whole shebang!
136282.name: Rabbids: Das Familien-Partyspiel

136283.name: Memento
136283.description:
Take a card and remember what you took. Easy, no?

No, because in Memento each card has both a color and shape on it, and each color and shape has a different scoring method with different priorities. On top of that, you'll want to remember the order in which you took various cards because their sequence matters, too. If this game proves too simple for a memory mastermind like yourself, then step up to the professional version of gameplay and see whether you can still keep things in order.

136284.description:
Introductory version of the original Pelican Cove: Low entry-level and even faster games!
It works in the same way as the big one, but is packed in a small cheap box, and has different cards.
The card levels are just 1, 2, and 3, so don't expect Mensa-level challenges (unless you put double-challenges by each bird of course).

The cards from Uluru: Neuer Tumult am Ayers Rock can be used to expand play in Pelican Cove.
136284.name: Uluru: Neuer Tumult am Ayers Rock
boardgamepodcastepisode: nba003 – Auf Traumpfaden durch die Terra Nullius

136285.name: Ubongo: Das Würfelspiel
136285.description:
In Ubongo: Das Würfelspiel, players are once again trying to place polyominoes in order to fill in shapes – but this time the polyominoes are determined via dice rolls, forcing players to scramble to grab what they need before anyone else can snatch the shape.

Each player has a scoring sheet that contains a shape she needs to fill. On a turn, the active player rolls all eight Ubongo dice in the center of the table, then each player must grab exactly one black die and one white die. The player then uses the shapes on these dice to fill in her playing area, if possible. When a player completely fills the space, she yells "Ubongo!" and scores points. The other players continue to play until they have also completed their shapes and scored, then they move onto the next area on their scoring sheets.

Whoever has the most points after six rounds wins!

136286.name: Star Wars: Bounty Hunter – Das Würfelspiel
136286.description:
Star Wars: Bounty Hunter - Das Würfelspiel takes you and your fellow players into the huge Star Wars universe in the role of bounty hunters.

Each round, Darth Vader issues a decree as to which rebel you now need to capture, then the players take turns bidding on how many dice and dice rolls it will take them to roll what's needed and capture the rebel in question. The boldest player (i.e., the lowest bidder) will have the first chance to attempt a capture, but if you've overestimated your abilities, you'll end up with nothing to show for it. After fifteen rebels – including Luke Skywalker, Han Solo and Princess Leia Organa – have been captured by the bounty hunters, whoever holds the most task cards wins.

136287.name: Wer kennt München?
136287.description:
"Who knows München - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Augsburg.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

136288.description:

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Mannheim.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.

Player with the most points is the winner.

136292.description:
"Who knows Münster - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know your city or region? With over 500 questions about Münster.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Players bet correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. An correct answer scores points and the player may continue answering. A wrong answer eliminates a player from the session.
The game lasts until there are no players left or the session is over.

The player with the most points is the winner.
136292.name: Wer kennt Münster?

136299.description:

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.

Player with the most points is the winner.

136300.name: Wer kennt den Bodensee?
136300.description:
"Who knows Bodensee - The Original Region Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about the region/lake Constance (Bodensee).

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

136301.name: Warriors of Ras: Journey I, Kaiv; Journey II, Dunzhin
136301.description:
User Summary

A UK-released compilation of the first two games in the Warriors of RAS series.

136302.name: Ford Mustang: The Legend Lives
136302.description:
Back of the Box

Race 40 Years of American Muscle - Ford Mustang

- Features 40 incredibly rendered production, concept and racing models from 1964 to 2005.

- Choose from a diverse set of 22 accurately modeled, life-like racing environments in 7 cities from across the USA.

- Arcade-style racing physics and realistic AI, from opponents as well as from obstacle traffic.

- Compete in "coin-op" style Challenges or Career Mode to unlock new cars, tracks and game modes while testing your skills to the limit.

- Split screen Multiplayer support for Head-to-Head racing.

136303.name: Winter Sports 3: The Great Tournament
136303.description:
Back of the Box

RTL Winter Sports 2010 is the Ultimate Tournament Event!

Play alone or with friends and enjoy the coolest sports the winter season has to offer. Loads of fast-paced fun guaranteed!

Features:

- 8 exciting disciplines: Snowboard Cross, Freeride Skiing, Downhill Skiing, Sky Flying, Shorttrack Speed Skating, Biathlon, Bobsled and Figure Skating

- Full online support for gripping multiplayer matches

- Develop your game character in career mode

- Global highscore lists

136304.name: Yu-Gi-Oh! The Falsebound Kingdom
136304.description:
Back of the Box

An All New Yu-Gi-Oh! Challenge!

Uncover Brand-New Original Storylines!

Yugi and his friends are trapped inside a virtual reality game that is completely out of control. Save your friends and team up to fight your way to freedom! Play as either Yugi or Kaiba in two completely different storylines. There are many secrets and plot twists to discover as players make their way through "The Kingdom".

3-on-3 Field Monster Battles!

Gain experience, reach new levels and learn new attacks! Create teams of 3 monsters and travel across vast landscapes while battling enemies. Discover sensational special attacks and combos! The simple controls let you pit realistic 3D monsters head to head in dazzling battles with ease!

Witness the Might "Egyptian God Monsters" in Action!

The Three "Egyptian God Monsters" make their 3D debut in the Yu-Gi-Oh! World! Learn the full truth about the most powerful monsters known to mankind!

3 Limited Edition Official Game Cards Inside!

User Summary

New versions of this game include Promotional Holographic versions of the following three cards:
- Metalzoa
- Zoa
- Goblin Fan

136305.description:
Track Design to the Finish Line!

Mad Rush Rally is a game where you take turns building the track while you're racing on it! This allows you to create the track to suit your own strategy. You can even design your own short-cut to jump to first place!

Players gain insane and fun-to-use items; Items like the Booster, which let's you jet ahead of the competition; the Dodge Ball, which whacks your friend into missing their next turn; the Squirrel, which creates a roadblock forcing players to change course; or the Bomb which decimates the track and all on it! Plus more items that shift the balance of the game! What's more, some items are left on the track to be used by or to hinder your friends, making each game even more unique.

Mad Rush Rally offers a familiar but fresh experience combining kart racing inspired video games with a simple yet revolutionary map-building game mechanic that brings fun back to the table.
136305.name: Mad Rush Rally

136307.name: App'd: The Card Game
136307.description:
App'd is a game for 2-4 players where players try to be the first to fill up 100% of their brain's space with apps without going over. Players draw cards from the deck trying to get App cards, expansion cards or hardware cards that will help them reach that goal of 100%.
Taken from Kickstarter description

136308.name: Sturmgeboren
136308.description:
from the back of the book

North of Weiden, between the Red Crescent, the Neunaugensee and the Salamandersteine, lies the Hardorp plane. So far, none of the neighbors were interested in the barren land, known for its dust storms. That is changing, as a Knight of Donnerbach lays claim to this no man's land. Indeed she failed the first attempt to colonize the plane, but the knight is determined to lead the company in a second attempt to succeed.

The project is controversial and even the duke-priest Aldare VIII Donnerhall of Donnerbach is skeptical. Unlike her heir Thali who supports the efforts of some families of Donnerbach. From the city from at the Gorothir to the settlers should move to the plane, but this time with the support of young professionals who are eager to face the perils of the plane - real heroes.

They will help with the construction of a new settlement and establish independent trade contacts with Norbardic dealers and the mining town Uhdenberg. They'll penetrate deep into the mysteries of the plane, and finally even fathom the mystery of the harsh and inhospitable nature of this land. Their investigations lead them to places that have deep roots in the past of the region, and drive them into the clutches of a being that has long fallen prey to oblivion.

boardgamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
136313.description:
Welcome back, Emperor. The time for unchecked expansion is over. Warmongers raise their flags over weaker empires, while civilized planets take shelter behind peace treaties. Brace yourself for rising tensions in this next chapter of Eminent Domain: Escalation!

This expansion for Eminent Domain, which cannot be played without the base game, puts the following new tools at the Emperor's disposal:


New meaning to the larger-sized ships in Eminent Domain.
Additional Role cards to support a fifth player.
Additional technologies, each with an alternate cost in addition to their normal Research cost.
A new category of technology ("Diverse"), requiring one planet of each type to research.
Optional scenarios for asymmetric starting positions and technologies for each player.
boardgameversion: Tasty Minstrel Kickstarter Foil Stamped Edition

boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 017 – I, Geek interviews Seth Jaffee
Episode 10 - Eminent Domain Review
Episode 7 - Uncorking Our Favorite Expansions
MN 0052 Seth Jaffee talks Eminent Domain and more

The Good The Board and The Doomed To Repeat: Episode 70 “Historical Games”
The Good, The Board and The That’s What She Said: Episode 67 “Long vs Short……….Games”

136314.description:
In this expansion, the "Pass" action is replaced with the "Play an Action Card" option.

There are several Action Cards available:

- Discard a bull card
- Discard a china card from the general display
- Draw a money card
- Exchange a china card you own with a china card from the general display
- Replace all bull cards with new ones
- Make the player to your right play
136314.name: Bull in a China Shop: Action Cards

136315.name: Pitfall!
136315.description:
On his 30th Anniversary, take control of Pitfall Harry once again in PITFALL!, inspired by the 1982 Classic that started it all, now re-envisioned and re-booted on iOS!
 
Escape the wrath on an angry volcano while collecting ancient treasures in PITFALL!, an adrenaline-fuelled, free-running adventure set in a deadly jungle with twists and turns that will always keep you on your toes. As the iconic Pitfall Harry, test your skills to race through jungles, caves and native villages while avoiding death-defying obstacles such as fiery volcanic flames, tumbling ancient artefacts, and narrow cliff side pathways. Challenge your reflexes by jumping, sliding, and using your deadly whip to take out classic PITFALL! foes like rattlesnakes and scorpions while avoiding the death grip of a crocodile’s jaw as you swing across ravines.  Make sure to always keep a watchful eye as danger lurks around every corner!

Source: The Publisher Website.

136316.name: Zoom!
136316.description:
I see, I see little eye ... and wears glasses ...

Search as fast as you can as many objects and people to the description on the wheel, mark what you find with the stickers of your color. Hurry because the sandglass!
Six fun and beautifully illustrated looking plates, twenty four assignments, a wheel and an unpredictable sandglass: these are the elements of this super cute look and search game.

Each player gets stickers and a scoreboard in the chosen color. Then you can choose which side of the wheel you play, simple or slightly tougher side! Choose a board game together, turn the sandglass and ready ... START!

Whoever has the most stickers is the winner of the round!

136317.name: Nightmares & Dreams Web Enhancement: Free Monsters
136317.description:
From Introduction:

Here you will find the compilation of our free monsters from the Nightmares & Dreams prerelease promotion.

Add these great creatures to the N&D collection and offer up more horror or strangeness to you d20 campaign.

The Monsters in this free collection are:

The Weedling
The Bladesnake
The Unknitter
The Heartbreaker
The Black Lover
The Dream Dragon
The Dancing Dead
The Catnap
The Dream Elemental
And The Crimson Orb

136323.name: War Thunder
videogamehonor: 2013 Gamescom Best Simulation Game of the Year Winner
2013 Global Game Awards Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
136323.description:
War Thunder is an MMO combat game dedicated to World War II military aviation, armored vehicles, and fleets. You will take part in all of the major combat battles, fighting with real players all over the world.

War Thunder offers a highly detailed and personalized aviation experience, giving players access to hundreds models of planes with detailed cockpits, dozens of upgradeable weapons, and flying skills that can be honed and improved with each mission. Thanks to the game’s painstaking attention to detail, you’ll truly feel like a World War II fighter pilot as you plunge into battle.

The genuine World War II experience isn’t limited to the skies. The massive historical battles featured in War Thunder cannot be fought by aviation alone, so the game will also expose players to combat on land and at sea.

Features include:

- Varied PvP-experiences set in full-scale combat missions
-Multiple settings options allow advanced virtual pilots and beginners to enjoy playing the game together
-Rich PvE content: dynamic campaigns, solo missions, mission editor, and much more for single-player and cooperative gameplay
-Impressive diversity includes detailed models of planes and their cockpits, as well as tanks and ships
-Astonishing graphics, authentic sound effects, and beautiful music

Source: The Game Website.

136324.name: TNT (The Narrative Toolbox)
136324.description:
From publisher blurb:

TNT (The Narrative Toolbox) is a rules-light, narrative-heavy roleplaying game.

The game mechanics are focused on one thing: narrative control. The rules don't attempt to simulate how things work in the game world. They assume that everyone understands how the game world works and what kinds of things are possible, depending on the genre. What the rules DO help you decide is who gets to take control of the narrative and describe what happens next in the story of the game.

Based around the concept of universal character archetypes and the roles they play in adventure stories of all genres, TNT is effectively a universal roleplaying game that can be used to play any kind of story about any kind of characters in any kind of world.

If you can dream it, you can do it in TNT.

136326.name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (GBA)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
136326.description:
Box of US GBA Box

DARE TO RETURN TO HOGWARTS

Be Harry Potter in his second adventure - all new for Game Boy Advance.

Features
-Stunning new 3D isometric graphics bring Harry's world to life
-Fly into action with new 3D Quidditch
-Unlock the mystery of the Chamber of Secrets
-Learn fantastic second-year spells
-Connect with your Nintendo GameCube to unlock secret levels and mini-puzzles (GameCube game and connecting cable required)

136327.name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (PS1)
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
136327.description:
Back of US Playstation Case

DARE TO RETURN TO HOGWARTS

Be Harry Potter in his second Playstation adventure - solve the mystery of the Chamber of Secrets

FEATURES
-Go deeper into Harry's world with powerful second-year spells, Wizard Duels, Quidditch League, and Floo Powder travel
-New Puzzles and wizard games
-Meet new characters including Gilderoy Lockhart, Dobby, Fawkes, and Ginny Weasley.
-More creatures, items, magic, and adventure

136328.name: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (GBC)
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
videogamehonor: 2003 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Audio of the Year Nominee
2005 British Academy Game Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Winner
136328.description:
US GBC Box Back

DARE TO RETURN TO HOGWARTS?

BE HARRY POTTER AND UNLOCK THE MYSTERY AT THE HEART OF THE CHAMBER OF SECRETS.

-A "portable" journey to Hogwarts with over 100 of your favorite characters (including Gilderoy Lockhart), magical encounters and spells.

-Go deeper into Harry's second adventure - Can you clear Harry's name andn sovle the mystery of the Chamber of Secrets?

-Featuring Quidditch for the first time on Game Boy Color.

-8 new mini-games (including car flying, de-gnoming and pixie catching), plus more opportunities to collect and trade Famous Witch and Wizard Cards between two Game Boy Color games.

-Multiple character dueling - Harry's friends Ron and Hermione join him in his exciting encounters.

136330.name: TNT (The Narrative Toolbox) Example of Play
136330.description:
From publisher blurb:

TNT is a different kind of roleplaying game. Inspired by the “indie” idea of using rules and game mechanics to determine not what happens, but rather who gets to describe what happens, TNT gameplay is both very similar and very different from what you get with a more traditional roleplaying game. That being the case, we thought that an example of play might be helpful. This isn’t supposed to be the one and only way to play the game. Some groups like to give players even more expansive narrative rights, while others prefer to keep the players’ narrations focused on the task they’re attempting. Both options are fine. As you read through the following example, remember that there’s no wrong way to play.

TNT (The Narrative Toolbox) is a simple universal roleplaying game that allows you and your friends to play any kind of story about any kind of characters in any kind of world. If you can dream it, you can do it in TNT.

136333.name: BLUEHOLME Prentice Rules
rpghonor: 2014 Indie Game of the Year Runner-Up
2014 Indie RPG Awards Best Production Runner-Up
2014 Indie RPG Awards Best Support Runner-Up
136333.description:
From publisher blurb:

BLUEHOLME Prentice Rules is a table top fantasy roleplaying game that emulates the game play of the original basic rule book, popularly known as the Holmes Edition or simply the Blue Book. The rules in this book allow for characters of 1st to 3rd levels, and include everything the referee could possibly need to create and run a campaign in the Underworld: monsters, magic, treasure, and … well, what more do you need?

136334.name: BlackBerry PlayBook
136334.description:
User Summary

The BlackBerry PlayBook is a tablet which runs on BlackBerryOS. Games can be bought and downloaded from The BlackBerry App World Store. It was released on April 19, 2011.

136337.description:
The future is here! Build the foundations of the Future Ages of Exploration in Culture, Science, Trade and Military while forming the Organizations that will rule Mankind.

Space Marvels 6 Express (SM6e) is a PnP Express tile laying game for 2 to 5 players in the vein of 7 Wonders playable in 15-20 minutes.

Players begin by each choosing a different Marvel Board, divided into 3 different sections, or Ages of exploration. Each board gives the player an initial resource. Players are also given 3 credits to start the game.

Players are then dealt a hand of tiles (8 tiles 2-3 players, 6 tiles for 4-5 players) and may do one of three things during each phase of a round:

a. Play a tile if they can pay the cost in resources, gaining future benefits, resources, and other bonuses
b. Use the tile face down + pay resources to build a section of their Marvel (thereby gaining bonus abilities)
c. Discard the tile for 3 credits

Players may play their tiles simultaneously and may buy resources from neighboring players at a cost of 2 credits.

After each player has played a tile, all players pass their remaining tiles to the player next to them.

The rounds end when all tiles dealt have been played. A VP scoring round them occurs comparing Military strengths of each player. VP is awarded and a new round begins with the next set of tiles.

After 3 rounds of play, groups of tiles are scored for VP based upon Organizations built as well as credits earned and final Military strengths of each player.

Player with the most VP is the winner.

For the 2 player game, a dummy hand of tiles is dealt and players use that dummy hand as part of the hand passing portion of the game.

Winner - 2013 In-A-Tin/Express Contest - Best Pre-Contest Game
136337.name: Space Marvels 6 Express
boardgamepodcastepisode: Printin' and Playin' Episode 7 - Top 5 of 2013 - #4: Space Marvels 6 Express

136338.name: Call of Duty: Black Ops II – Revolution
videogameexpansion: Call of Duty: Black Ops II
136338.description:
User Summary

Activision has announced the first DLC for Black OPS 2 in the form of the Revolution map pack. This will contain 4 multiplayer maps, 1 zombie co-operative map, 1 new zombie game mode, and a new gun.

Activision says this is the first time that a weapon has been included in an expansion for the Call of Duty Franchise.

136339.name: Hello, Mr. Gravedigger
136339.description:
A game for the 2013 2-p PnP Game Design Contest.

A worker-placement game in which the two players are competing Funeral Home operators. The goal is to satisfy the funerary wishes of the deceased through the collection of coffins, cemetery plots, and headstones. The harder to please the client is, the closer you are to satisfying the deceased's wishes, and the faster you can accomplish it, the more points you're awarded at their funeral. But, should you fail to keep them happy, your customers might crawl up from their tombs to complain!

Apart from standard worker-placement fare, this game utilizes a unique time mechanic that dictates when and where players may place their workers. More difficult actions require more time to complete, and players must balance the use of their time against the monetary costs of their actions.

136343.name: Campaign 1814
videogamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts  Best Pre-20th Century Era Computer Wargame Nominee
136343.description:
After the decisive Battle of Leipzig the French retreated to the Rhine and beyond into France. Following them were the victorious forces of the Sixth Coalition. Napoleon positioned his forces on the Rhine, in Holland and in Belgium and then left for Paris to build new field commands. Eugene was in northern Italy facing an Austrian army under Bellegarde. And of course the war in Spain was winding down.

The Allies did not wait for Napoleon to bring up his new army and began to cross the Rhine at several points. The understrength French corps were no match for the Allied juggernaut and retired by stages closer to the west. By the end of January the Allies had advanced to within one hundred miles of Paris!

What followed from that point, until the end of the campaign, was one of Napoleon's most remarkable campaigns. Fielding an army one third the size of the Allied forces he won one stunning victory after another. Unfortunately he was never able to achieve a decisive victory. The Allied armies gradually ground down the outnumbered French forces and after the Battle of Paris he was forced to abdicate.

As either Napoleon, Emperor of the French and King of Italy, or as Schwarzenberg and Blücher, field commanders of the Allied legions, you can relive those exciting days! With over four hundred scenarios, and more than ten campaigns, all of the major actions of the 1814 Campaign in northwest France are covered in detail. Units such as the Gendarmes d'Espanol and the Baden Guard Grenadiers have been added to the 1813-14 inventory for the players to command.

Come experience the drama of the campaign as your men shiver in the cold waiting for your next command. Will you, as Napoleon, keep your throne, or will you as the Allied commanders, march victoriously into Paris? The choice is yours as you ride off into destiny!

Source: The Publisher Website.

136344.name: Dragons (1978)
136344.description:
In-game Instructions

Long, long ago, men knew many secrets which we people have forgotten. Nature was not so kind as today, and great creatures lived in the depths of the earth.

It is the year 869, and you are an adventurer in Denmark. You are drawn by tales of a great treasure of over 5000 gold pieces, said to be in a castle inhabited by monsters of every sort.

You come to the village near the castle. You are surprised by how easy it is to find a place to stay. Then you realize that the people expect to keep your belongings when you are lost in the dungeon.

The dungeon is on three levels. The first level contains the entrance, many corridors, and many rooms. The second level is almost the same as the first except that there are more monsters and more scattered treasures.

The third level consists of one large room with several branching passages and their adjoining rooms. The large room contains the treasure of 5000 gold pieces.

Your objective is to reach the third level and return to the surface with the 5000 gold pieces.

(Excerpts from the in-game instructions continue in the More Information section below.)

136345.name: Imazine (Issue 38 - Late 2002)
136345.description:
Table of Contents

Products ......3
The Other ....10
Colloquy .....15

User comment:
This was the final issue of Imazine

136346.name: Dungeon Escape (1980)
136346.description:
Publisher Advertisement

At last!! An adventure which takes quick thinking and strategy!

Different from fixed adventures.


Super graphics. Interactive Sound. Uses latest programming techniques.
Fast Paced - the creator's ghost has sensed an intruder, and he is determined to hunt you down. (His intelligence in tracking was set by you). This feature makes this simulation unlike others for you're always "on the go."
Written by an experienced gamer in fantasy role-playing, based on the game Dungeons & Dragons.


Objective: Your character begins on the first of a three level dungeon, searching for magical "stones" which permit you to descend to the next lower level

The Adventure: There are numerous traps, and over a dozen hostile monsters that come in various sizes, shapes and degrees of nastiness. It has various treasures and magic items (weapons, elixers, cloaks, scrolls, etc.) You can become a fighter, a thief or a magic-user. Each time you play you get a totally different and exciting game.

This short description only begins to tell you of the many adventures and some of the features of this exciting game.

This will be your favorite adventure game!

136347.name: Sorcerer: The Apprentice Version
136347.description:
Introductory note:
Thanks for taking a look at Sorcerer! Come on by the official website at: http://www.sorcerer-rpg.com
There you can order the full Adobe Acrobat version of the game. It includes great art, a wider range of character creation options, a hefty section on preparing good stories for Sorcerer, lots more examples, and a whole section on demon creation you can't get anywhere else.

From the Introduction:
In this roleplaying game, each player creates and runs a powerful
sorcerer in the modern-day world.

User commentary:
This is a 'lite' version of the game. It contains methods for everything needed to run the game, but less material than in the full version of the game.

136348.name: Hidden Valley
136348.description:
Publisher Advertisement

From the bowels of the dankest dungeons come all of the elements necessary for the most challenging foray into excitement you've ever seen on your TRS-80! The object of the game is to take a character of your own creation through an awesome 99 separate levels of dungeons. Along the way, you'll come face to fang with a myriad of malevolent monsters -- but for the stout of heart, pure of soul, and, occasionally, the fleet of foot, there is wealth to be had -- and lots of it, too!

No detail has been overlooked! Purchase your supplies -- weaponry, foodstuff, magicks, and armor -- then outfit a character of your own design for entry into the dungeon itself. The player has TOTAL control over dozens of variables, including character creation, dungeon levels, the buying AND selling of supplies (one may need to finance one's next dungeon adventure!), and dungeon/character saving for later play.

Certainly one of the most exciting fantasy programs ever devised for the TRS-80. If you've grown tired of arcade-type fare, then perhaps it's time to enter a world where you can live the fantastic. HIDDEN VALLEY -- you may never want to leave. Skill Level: Advanced.

By Marc B. Stanis

Program Parameters

Language: Hybrid
Number of Players (min/max): 1/1
Average Completion Time: 1 Month
Suggested Age Group: 12 to Adult
Recommended for Novice? No
Classification: Role-Playing Adventure
Sound? Yes
Game Save Feature? Yes
Multiple Skill Levels? No
Graphics Oriented? Yes
Real Time? Partial

136349.name: Reign of the Red Dragon
136349.description:
Publisher Advertisement

Demon Venture #1

Step into the fantastic -- into a magical, mystical domain populated by gallant warriors and nightmarish vermin. Experience first-hand the ecstasy of a near-impossible quest successfully completed or the crushing despair of a hideous death at the slavering jaws of some denizen from the netherworld. REIGN OF THE RED DRAGON is the frist of an exciting new fantasy series that gives you complete control over the design and outfitting of characters of your OWN creation! Select your character types -- Human, dwarf, elf, warrior, cleric, magician or thief; purchase your supplies, weapons and magics, then brace yourself for entry into the dark, sorcerous realms that are the sole domain of the horror that is known as THE RED DRAGON! Fantasy role-playing at its finest! Difficulty Level: Moderate.

By Dave Daring

Program Parameters

Language: Basic
Number of Players (min/max): 1/5
Average Completion Time: 2 Weeks
Suggested Age Group: 13 to Adult
Recommended for Novice? Yes
Classification: Role-Playing Adventure with real-time action
Game Save Feature? Yes
Multiple Skill Levels? Yes
Graphics Oriented? Yes
Real Time? Partially

136350.name: Troll Crusher
136350.description:
Documentation

Introduction

Trollcrusher is a role-playing adventure game. It is a derivative of the many "Dungeon" programs for mini and micro-computers, but it combines the style of traditional complex 'conversational' games with the pace of real-time games such as 'Star Trek'. The best way to get the 'feel' of Trollcrusher is to actually play the game. These notes explain the game's structure and recommend some techniques of play - there are no instructions included in the game itself since they would reduce the space available for the simulation routines.

Overview

The player's objective is to explore a network of caves and escape alive with as much treasure as possible. Credit is also given to players who manage to kill many monsters or descend deep into the dungeon before escaping (or being slain). The game is played in real-time - consequently decisions must be quickly taken, since the longer a player delays the greater the chance that a monster will attack. The game may be played at nine different speeds, depending upon the key pressed at the start of the game, '1' (slowest) to '9' (fast).

Exploring

At each stage of play the adventurer may choose between a number of courses ahead. These options are displayed on the screen, and may be selected by pressing a single key (so no vocabulary need be learnt). The meaning of some keys changes according to the situation - new meanings are displayed as appropriate.

Levels and leaving the dungeon.

The dungeon consists of about 20 'levels', although its depth varies at different points in the cave-maze. The player begins on level 1, where the monsters are fairly weak (in general) and there is not much treasure to be found. By moving down stairways (or falling into pits, chasms or other traps!) it is possible to move into the lower, more challenging levels. The deeper the level the more treasure monsters are likely to possess and the stronger they will be. The only reliable way to move UP a level is via a staircase, although teleportation sometimes changes a player's level unpredictably.

136351.name: Chessex Single-Sided Mats
136351.description:
from the Chessex website

Gamers have long preferred the special textured vinyl we use in manufacturing our mats. When our supplier discontinued its production years ago, we made special arrangements to keep this high quality vinyl available to us. Unfortunately, this arrangement for our single-sided mats required us to order large amounts of vinyl that would last us a long time. In 2007, the price increases on the single-sided vinyl made it more expensive than the vinyl for the reversible mats. This meant reversible mats would be only slightly more expensive than the single-sided mats. Our sales statistics echoed the consumer opinion that getting essentially a second product for a few dollars more was the better option. Due to these criteria we have decided to discontinue future production of single-sided mats - a decision that was not an easy one to make.

We still have some single-sided patterns in stock and will continue to sell those until we run out. Some of the remaining stock is on sale. These are mat patterns for game systems which have waned in popularity over the years, but still retain their usefulness. We recommend you check out what is available on the single-sided mat page.

Sizing: Battlemat™ = 26” x 23½” (66cm x 60cm)
Sizing: Megamat™ = 34½” x 48” (88cm x 122cm)

136353.name: Engine
136353.description:
From the introduction:

ENGINE is a game atop another game.

To play ENGINE, you must have and play either Apocalypse World by Vincent Baker, or one of the many games derived from it. Playing with one of its derived games with ENGINE will take a bit more work, as this game is designed with Apocalypse World in mind. It should work, though. Caveat: If you can use the word "dark" to describe the game, it should work.

Just play the game as normal, but add the provided Principles. Then, once done, play ENGINE. Play it right after, or play it another day. Either way works.

From the back cover:

ENGINE helps you to tell a story of renewal. It helps you to explore the causes and ramifications of the things that occurred in the original story.

It does not reflect on all Moves, or all Principles. Not by far. But this is a foundation. If you choose to build more Moves, we'd love to hear about them.

136354.name: The Time Raider
136354.description:
From the Back of the Book:

You find yourself at the control panel of the TIME RAIDER, an amazing time machine. Push a button and you will hurtle forward into the future. Push a different button and you will sail back into the distant past. Which will you choose?


Will you choose to visit the future City of Silver where slaves on a spaceship beg you to free them from their evil master? Turn to page 8.



Will you travel back to early pioneer days where you must save the life of Daniel Boone-or change history forever? Turn to page 64.


In a TWISTAPLOT book, you decide what path to take-and what will happen once you get there. When you finish one adventure, you are ready to set out on another. It's time to start now. You decide where time and the TIME RAIDER will take you. Happy travels!

136355.name: The Train of Terror
136355.description:
From the Back of the Book:

Do you dare to ride... the train of terror?

It's no ordinary train. In one car, a beautiful woman is turning passengers into robots! In another, a scarfaced man watches your every move! And you are sure that the person next to you is a jewel thief! How will you get away from these people?


If you try to outwit the robot woman, turn to page 54.



If you want to find out what the scarfaced man is doing with that knife, turn to page 38.



If you decide to forget your trip and join up with the jewel thief, turn to page 42.


But be warned! In a Twistaplot book, you decide what path to take and what to do once you get there. The wrong choice could cost you your life. The right one could make you a star! The choice is up to you.

So climb aboard and see where you and the Train of Terror are headed!

136356.description:
A pirate lives on skill, guile and fortune's fair eye, dreading the day his luck finally runs dry.  Before ye lies a sack of sixty golden doubloons – a king's ransom and a good day's haul. Each of the crew is entitled to a share equal to his rank and station aboard, and as a crew of thieving pirates, each has his own unique talent for prying coins out of the hands of his shipmates. Take all ye deserve – but no more than prudence allows for the treasure be cursed!  

Within the sack are coins bearing the Black Spot. To hold such a coin is to feel the icy hand of death upon ye – but to not be able to rid oneself of its curse is death itself. Best find someone else's pocket to line it with, lest ye find yer pirating days at an end.

Dread Curse is a push-your-luck game of cunning thievery and ample turns of fortune.  Play revolves around drawing loot from a cloth bag and stealing from the other pirates in order to gain the most valuable stash of treasure. Each turn, players reveal coins from their hidden cache to win the captaincy or one of the other seven crew assignments, each of whom are able to draw from the bag in a unique way or use a special "cheat" ability available only to that pirate. Stay in as long as you dare to grab more gold, but beware the Black Spot for if you end the game with it in your stash, you automatically lose.
136356.name: Dread Curse
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 44 - Pandemic: Contagion
Podcast #10: Pirates & Politics
TDT - Episode # 318 - Live from Gen Con 2013

136357.name: Goblin Pit Fight
136357.description:
Goblin Pit Fight is a card game in which players choose one of four tribes of Goblins. This fast paced game generally takes 30-60 minutes to play. The object is to create the best hand; outscoring other players and possibly defeating the pit for extra points. It has an easy to learn, multi-level scoring system that allows players to be creative when building a hand. Each player keeps a camp, where they can secure cards for future hands.

Gameplay overview:

Each player is dealt 7 cards from which they have to make a four card hand. Players put one card into the center as their Pit card. They then have two cards left over for their Camp which rolls from turn to turn allowing players to always have two cards in reserve for future hands.

Scoring is based on card icons such as tribe, class, bone value, and Pit strength. All of these icons allow for different ways to score points each hand.

136358.name: Donald Featherstone's Wargaming Pike and Shot Revised Edition
136358.description:
From the back cover:

"Each battle described in this book is a significant and outstanding example of the art of war and the
development of military tactics period. They are highly suitable for scaling-down to realistic table-top proportions because of the size of the armies and the area of the battlefield

By refighting them, the wargamer can transform themselves into an
historical commander, savour his excitement and triumphs and suffer failure in judgements and disappointments.

This book contains:

An introduction to wargaming the period,
fifteen battles, each illustrated with maps,
notes on suitable rules and wargaming figures,
an updated bibliography and
a previously unpublished set of English Civil War rules by Donald Featherstone

The History of Wargaming Project is edited by John Curry.
It aims to present the very best of classic wargaming books and rules to a modern audience."

136359.name: Donald Featherstone's Wargamer's Handbook Of The American War Of Independence Wargaming 1775-1783
136359.description:
From the back cover:

"A guide to the men, the weapons, the battles, and campaigns and how to re-fight them in miniature. The American War of Revolution 1775-1783 is a war of battles bearing colourful names, most of them ideally suited for re-fighting on table-top battlefields. The skilful general can triumphantly turn historical defeats into victories. This book tells the wargamer how to don the mantle of Washington and lead American Armies against British regulars to display greater tactical genius than Burgoyne and Cornwallis. After outlining the historical course of the war, the soldiers of both sides and their styles of fighting are described and commanders evaluated. This means re-fighting the major battles as wargames are explained, with maps of the battlefields transformed into table-top terrains. Hints on formulating rules include two complete sets that authentically simulate warfare of the period. A new chapter, with a previously unpublished set of rules by Donald Featherstone, is included in this edition."

136361.name: Stars of Inequity
136361.description:
From the publisher's website:

Stars of Inequity is a supplement for Rogue Trader that presents tempting new opportunities for those brave few who make their livings in the Koronus Expanse.

This detailed resource focuses on the perilous worlds of the Expanse. Game Masters can create their own new realms with the World Generator, a system designed to craft unique planets filled with terrible risks and unmatched potential for profit. Players can brave the dangers of planetside missions, crossing the surface of shadowy worlds to explore deadly jungles, ancient ruins, crashed voidships, and more. And with the Colony Creation rules, your group can construct, expand, and control its own outposts on the lost and forgotten worlds of the Expanse!

136362.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The dwarf shrugged. "Do you want to wager your throne upon a woman's whim? Go to Westeros, though ... ah, then you are a rebel, not a beggar. Bold, reckless, a true scion of House Targaryen, walking in the footsteps of Aegon the Conqueror. A dragon."
–George R.R. Martin, A Dance with Dragons

A Journey's End is the sixth and final Chapter Pack in the "A Song of the Sea" cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! Will your journey end in ruin or conquest? The pack's sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards) launch players into heated naval battles and chaotic melees with five new Warships, five cards to support the game's Melee keyword, Mercenary lords, renowned Captains, and three new Prayers for the devout as they call to the Seven for guidance.

A Journey's End also concludes the "A Song of the Sea" cycle with three new cards to support the naval () enhancement. Each of the Great Houses has wagered its future upon a path it hopes will lead toward dominion over the Seven Kingdoms. At A Journey's End, it is time for you to throw in your lot. Will you wager your shot at the throne upon a whim? Or will you steer a true course – bold, direct, and fearless – as a conquerer come to claim your birthright?
136362.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Journey's End
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

136363.name: Wargaming Nineteenth Century Europe 1815-1878
136363.description:
From the back cover:
"Neil Thomas presents a set of fast-playing rules for wargaming the conflicts that reshaped Europe in the period 1815-78. This often-neglected period includes such significant conflicts as the Crimean War, the Italian Risorgimento, the wars of Bismarck's Prussia against Denmark, Austro-Hungary and France and ends with the Russo-Turkish war. Tactically, it saw armies struggle to adapt Napoleonic doctrines to incorporate important technological advances such as breech-loading rifles, greatly improved artillery and the first machine guns.A brief analysis of the essential strategic and tactical military developments of the period sets the context for the elegantly simple rules which are easy to learn, quick to play and yet deliver realistic outcomes. A selection of generic scenarios, covering flank attacks, pitched battles and meeting engagements, is supported by army lists for twenty-eight different armies. There are also twelve historical scenarios, ranging from the Battle of the Alma in the Crimean War to Sedan in 1870, the decisive battle of the Franco- Prussian War, each with historical background, deployment map, orders of battle and any special rules for that engagement. Useful appendices include a guide to further reading, an overview and price guide to the many scales and ranges of figures available, and a selection of useful addresses for the gamer. This is the ideal book for those new to gaming this period and veterans alike."

There are 5 types of generic scenarios:
Pitched Battle, Meeting Engagement,Rearguard Action, Flank Attack and Mini-Game.
And 10 (not 12 as the above shows) historical scenarios.
16 pages of color photos.

136365.name: Donald Featherstone's Lost Tales including Wargaming Rules 300 BC to 1945
136365.description:
From the publisher:

"Donald Featherstone was one of the dozen or so people who, in the 20th century, turned wargaming into both a hobby and a more useful tool for military professionals.' James F. Dunnigan 'Don’s Book 'War Games' in 1962 was an amazing thunderclap to an entire generation of would-be wargamers.' Paddy Griffith Through forty books on wargaming and military history, literally thousands of magazine articles and countless talks, Don’s energetic efforts made wargaming widely available, even respectable. However, despite this proliferation of writing, some areas remained hidden. 'Lost Tales' covers some of these omissions. This book covers diverse material from a lifetime’s experience of wargaming including: 'My War - Sergeant Featherstone 7893763' 'Modern Wargaming – How it all Began in the 1960’s.'

No less than twelve sets of Don’s favourite rules from ancients to World War II, including two unpublished sets. The History of Don’s unit, the 51st Tank Battalion The Royal Tank Regiment."

boardgamehonor: 2011 NZGA Children’s Choice Award Winner
136367.name: Time Zone
136367.description:
How Much Do You Know About New Zealand?

Time Zone is the quiz game that’s both historical and fun. Developed in conjunction with the New Zealand School Curriculum, Time Zone will have you racing to complete a time line of events and placing New Zealand in a historical perspective as you do so. Do you know which came first, regular television broadcasts in New Zealand or Sputnik 1? Was the Great Depression before or after Jean Batten’s flight to New Zealand? These and other challenging questions will have your mind racing.

Time Zone includes ten different game variations so you can play for hours. You can choose to play with all the cards, just the New Zealand event cards, or just the world events. Play against others or race the clock to place ten event cards in a time line to win. Time Zone is great for challenging friends, and since it’s appropriate for ages 9 and up, the whole family can join in.

boardgamehonor: 2009 NZGA New Game of the Year Winner
136369.name: The New Zealand Investment Game
136369.description:
The New Zealand Investment Game is an exciting strategic board game designed by highly respected investement writer, Frank Newman. It is an invaluable educational tool for both students and serious investors who are keen to flex their business muscles, without actually risking their own money! Invest in the sharemarket, buy property, invest in the money market, trade derivatives, opt into Kiwisaver or build a career. You choose your own strategy.

The unique software that accompanies the game simulates the investment markets, records all transactions, and provides end of game financial reports. All the paperwork is done for you, which frees you up to focus on the serious business of investing.

Real market data and thousands of investment scenarios so no two games are the same
Interactive tips and investment advice from Frank Newman
Online update for the latest game versions and market updates
At the end of the game each player receives a personalised report about their investment decisions.

Contains: game board, playing dice, playing pieces, game CD (includes rules and strategy).

Minimum system requirements: Windows 98/2000/XP/Vista or later, 128MB RAM, 233MHz processor, 50MB disc space, internet connection to obtain access key and download updates.

136370.name: Der Clou! Profidisk
136370.description:
User Summary

The "Profidisk" which requires the base game adds some new heists and also a few new characters. Most of the possible heists are something special: Rob a post train or rob a grave etc. They add a lot of new challenges.

136371.name: Nintendo 64 Controller Pak
136371.description:
User Summary

Used to save data for games.

136372.name: DualShock 2 Analog Controller
136372.description:
When the PlayStation 2 computer entertainment system was announced, the DualShock 2 Analog Controller (SCPH-10010) included with it was almost exactly the same externally as the previous DualShock analog controller, except that it was black (other colors came later), had different screw positioning in the back which counted one fewer screws, and the DualShock 2 logo was added. Another way to tell the DualShock and the DualShock 2 controllers apart is that the connector that plugs into the console matches that console's memory card shape; the DualShock’s connector has rounded shoulders and DualShock 2’s is squared off. The analog sticks were also noticeably stiffer for more accurate movements. Internally, the DualShock 2 was lighter and all of the buttons (except for the Analog mode, start, select, L3 and R3 buttons) were readable as analog values (pressure sensitive).

Source: Wikipedia, "DualShock", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

136374.name: Bushido Wars: The Way of the Samurai
136374.description:
In the turbulent feudal Japan, the warlords fighting each other to unify the country under the rule of his clan. Each player plays the Daimyo of one of these clans to become the new Shogun. One player that eliminates the Daimyo of the opposing faction will win the game, becoming the absolute sovereign of the country.

A game is played over many consecutive shifts, and will last until one of the players remove the enemy Daimyo. If at the beginning of his turn, a player has fewer cards than allowed, must draw a new card from the deck to add it to your hand. Then you have to do one of the following actions:
1. Attack (once per turn).
2. Cure (once per turn).
3. Pass.

136375.name: Mágové z Hexanu
136375.description:
At start the game board is randomly formed with the hex-tiles and players place their magicians on hexes.
In his turn player rolls dice and move one of his mage on the board from one hex to another so that the number on the hex-side the mage moves fits with the rolled number.

The objective is to move all of his six mages to magic-schools on the different hexes first.

Each mage reached on the school may start using magic spells.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
136376.description:
From the publisher's website:

An exciting reaction and dexterity game
The shells are turned over using the little hammer. If pearls appear, the players must quickly look quickly to see which side the whale is "swimming" on. If the colours match, they may grab the whale. Whoever manages to grab it may place a pearl in their boat. The winner is the player who fills their boat first.
This game focuses on dexterity, concentration and responsiveness.
136376.name: Lagoona

136377.description:
The 2013 Winter Offensive Bonus Pack includes a new board, number 66, and a new overlay, number 7. Three scenarios are included in the pack:

WO10 All Along the Merderet
WO11 Across the Issel
WO9 Sting'em at Zingem

Overlay 7 is a wide overlay that spans the width of the board providing a winding raised causeway between two marshes and is used in scenario "All Along the Merderet", contained in the pack.

All three scenarios use Board 66, an open rural board with a lateral road, some single hex buildings, most of which are stone, and a small level 1 and 2 hill which is notable in that it is partially covered by an orchard and is hedged.
136377.name: WO Bonus Pack #4: ASL Scenario Pack for Winter Offensive 2013

136378.name: Torn Apart by Radiation Wraiths (2nd Edition)
136378.description:
From publisher blurb:

You never know the truth about a person until they're bleeding out in front of you.

Maschine Zeit is a science fiction horror game, set in devastated stations suspended far above earth's surface. Explorers go to take valuables from the dead, to mine rare minerals from the stations or to collect the information needed to give proper funerals to the dead. The explorers are in for a surprise when they realize that many of the people didn't go away completely upon death. Their spirits are bound to the destroyed machines that brought their deaths.

Torn Apart by Radiation Wraiths is a one-shot, introductory adventure for Maschine Zeit. It contains character sheets for five characters traveling onto a station, a fully playable system primer, a number of modular scenes and an in-character map of the space. It's sufficient for a long night of tense gaming, or a couple of nights. Each character has a number of secrets and motivations, allowing the scenario to be run a number of times with completely different results.

Note: The files have all been recently edited and substantial amounts have been rewritten. The new version is quite a bit different from earlier this year.

136379.name: Flatpack: Fix the Future
136379.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you heard anyone say that the future's not so bright, and thought, "But I have lightbulbs?" If so, Flatpack is the game for you! Until someone tells us otherwise, we're saying that Flatpack: Fix the Future is the first game in the smash Hyperoptimistic Postapocalyptic genre of gaming. Flatpack is a game about building a new society using pre-apocalypse technology that you don't always trust or understand, and solving terrible problems creatively.

Flatpack uses simple resolution mechanics made to be playable for anyone that can read.
Think IKEA, meets Civilization, meets Actraiser, meets Earthbound, in pen and paper game form!
Cooperative and tongue-in-cheek gameplay focused on puzzles, brainteasers, and play achievements.

136380.name: Book of Obstacles
136380.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Order to 0vercome...
You're Going to need Obstacles
Flatpack: Fix the Future! is a roleplaying game with low prep time.
A brighter future is just a few page flips away!
The Book of Obstacles can give you ideas on the sorts of Obstacles your WRENCHs can encounter. Build on what’s within, or use these fleshed out adventure seeds as written for a no-prep game. You’ll find:

Ready made story hooks, no perperation needed if you already have an on how Flatpack works.
Ten two page spreads with art and inspiration. Print out a new page for the Manual and let the fun begin!
Short term or long term, the Obstacles within can work for quick adventure inspiration, or a longer game.
New player rewards! Suggestions for new Obstacle-based Achievements as well as potential Flatpacks to add to your collection. Troublemaking has never been easier!

136381.name: Book of Puzzles
136381.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's Time to take TiddlyWinks...
To the Next Level
Flatpack: Fix the Future! is a roleplaying game, but that doesn’t mean you have to stick to dice and characters sheets to have a good time at the table!
The Book of Puzzles takes the suggestions in the Flatpack Core and expand on using puzzles, brain teasers, and other games within your game of Flatpack. You’ll find:

Ready made story hooks to get the games and puzzles to your table.
Suggestions for variations on the theme. Like Five Card Draw in your Flatpack? Why not try a hand of your favorite collectable card game?
Take what you learned about using puzzles in a game of Flatpack and bring it to other games. Take your sword and socrecy game to the next level. Make your LARP night truely memorable.
Don’t take puzzles and games sitting down! Make the action real with the Get Up ‘n Move section. From bowling to zombie tag, you can use physical sports and games to your game of Flatpack!

136382.name: Magic Bus
136382.description: Magic Bus: depicts the 1969 summer concert season, including Woodstock and 15 other not so famous Rock Festivals. Point to point movement takes you across the nation to collect concert tickets which are combined into genre sets for scoring. Magic Bus can be played as a strict strategy game or as a combined experience of trivia and strategy. For the trivia version, on the back of each ticket is a list of hit songs that one must correctly name one of to keep the ticket.

136383.name: Station Zero: The Abusement Park
136383.description:
From publisher blurb:

When eccentric Trillionaire Clark Duncan finally heard about the scope of the space station tragedy, he saw money.
He told his people, “Build me a theme park, a scary one, with all those tubes and radio signal ghosts. I want that in a really scary theme park.” They told him he was crazy, that it was insensitive. That no one would come to a theme park based on those ideas.
He told them to build it anyway.
When they told him there were real survivors, real people with real accounts, he said, “great, get ‘em on board. Pay them consulting fees. It’ll add to the hype. No, of course I don’t know what a PTSD is.”
So Clark dumped a portion of his wealth into a ‘terror park.’ A first (and probably last) of it’s kind, a park meant to retell the awful ghost stories that come down from the derelict space stations still floating overhead.
Two years later, under the tightest security and best kept secrets in theme park history, Station Zero, an Adult Horror Adventure Park opened to five hundred special guests with about half that many employees on hand.
You are among their numbers.
When the stories of the what happened that day go public, will you be a survivor, or another hapless victim of...


Station Zero: The Abusement Park

Station Zero is a toolkit adventure for Maschine Zeit. You do not need Maschine Zeit to play! (Although, we recommend it. We rather enjoy it.) It consists of eight "rides." Each ride has a description, reasons for going there, and a few ideas for things with which to abuse the players. As well, we've included printable cards for each (cardstock recommended.) They have the logos for the rides, and the back sides have the descriptions and hooks, so you can put them out on the table for your players. It's a short module, perfect for very quick play, perfect for a Halloween pickup game.

Also included are five characters, ready to print and play. These characters are made to be compatible with our new Maschine Zeit 2.0 playtest rules, a draft of which are included.

136384.name: City of Sores: Living Forever in the City of Angels
136384.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inside, you'll find a full treatment of Los Angeles as a city. This includes a handful of sample Rings with which your players' characters can backstab, love, suffer, or otherwise interact. We touch on various neighborhoods and bits of Los Angeles history, all flavored with a bit of style, and a bit of immortality. We've included a story ready to play with minimal preparation. Lastly, you'll find the framework and seeds for telling an Epic in Los Angeles.

Three Courts, fleshed out with histories, rules, and NPCs.
A setting history primer.
Numerous new traits, spells, and Maneuvers for your characters.
Numerous characters, with ways to tie them to the PCs' backgrounds.
A plethora of story seeds to inspire your games.
